title: Runtime updates and feedback loop implementation

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

Huly Issue: LETTA-609

title: Types and config updates for OpenCode integration

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

- Modern hardware can handle 10+ Docker containers

- [ ] Still configurable via env var

Huly Issue: LETTA-143

title: Matrix task room manager service

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Create a Matrix room manager service responsible for lifecycle management of task-specific rooms, including creation, participant management, and teardown.

## Scope

- Define MatrixRoomManager interface
- Implement room creation with task metadata (name, topic, tags)
- Invite participants (calling agent, dev agent, optional human observers)
- Manage room permissions (widget support, read-only observers)
- Handle room closure and archival

## Acceptance Criteria

- Calling  creates Matrix room titled  with topic set to task description
-  handles both agent IDs and human Matrix user IDs
-  archives room and posts closing summary
- Room metadata includes task ID, agent IDs, timestamps

## Notes

- Use  patterns for power levels
- Ensure human observers default to read-only permissions
- Store room metadata in workspace block for retrieval

Huly Issue: LETTA-463

title: Matrix task room manager service

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Create a Matrix room manager service responsible for lifecycle management of task-specific rooms, including creation, participant management, and teardown.

## Scope

- Define MatrixRoomManager interface
- Implement room creation with task metadata (name, topic, tags)
- Invite participants (calling agent, dev agent, optional human observers)
- Manage room permissions (widget support, read-only observers)
- Handle room closure and archival

## Acceptance Criteria

- Calling  creates Matrix room titled  with topic set to task description
-  handles both agent IDs and human Matrix user IDs
-  archives room and posts closing summary
- Room metadata includes task ID, agent IDs, timestamps

## Notes

- Use  patterns for power levels
- Ensure human observers default to read-only permissions
- Store room metadata in workspace block for retrieval

title: Matrix-based multi-agent coordination via Synapse

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement Matrix (Synapse) as a coordination layer between Letta calling agents and OpenCode execution agents, enabling bidirectional communication, human-in-the-loop participation, and conversation archiving.

## Scope

- Create Matrix rooms per OpenCode task with automatic participant management
- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

- Provide commands/actions for humans to escalate (e.g., request changes, halt execution)

- Human user receives invitation when enabled in configuration
- Human messages are routed to both Letta calling agent and OpenCode dev agent
- Human can trigger task cancellation or request changes via Matrix command
- Documentation covers how humans join and interact with task rooms

## Notes

- Coordinate with permissions helper for power levels
- Ensure logging for human interventions for auditing
- Provide optional manual invitation command for ad-hoc observers

- Ensure logging for human interventions for auditing
- Provide optional manual invitation command for ad-hoc observers

Provide tooling to archive Matrix task rooms and enable later review of conversations, including search, replay, and summary capabilities.

## Scope

- Implement room archival process post-task completion
- Store conversation metadata linked to workspace blocks and task IDs
- Provide scripts/API to retrieve archives and generate summaries
- Integrate with future analytics/learning modules

## Acceptance Criteria

-  closes room and stores conversation history (events, participants, timestamps)
- Archive metadata searchable by task ID, agent ID, date range
- Summary report generated including key events (control signals, updates, completion)
- Documentation on how to retrieve and review archived conversations

## Notes

- Consider Matrix export APIs or client-side event fetching
- Store archives in dedicated storage (e.g., S3, database, filesystem)
- Ensure access control for archived data
- Coordinate with LETTA analytics roadmap

Huly Issue: LETTA-427

title: Runtime updates and feedback loop implementation

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Develop a message routing service that bridges Matrix room events to OpenCode task execution and vice versa, ensuring messages reach the correct participants and trigger appropriate actions.

## Scope

- Subscribe to Matrix room events for task rooms
- Forward relevant messages to OpenCode execution instances
- Relay OpenCode-generated updates (status, artifacts) back to Matrix room
- Ensure messages are tagged with task metadata for routing

## Acceptance Criteria

- Matrix messages with  metadata are parsed and routed correctly
- OpenCode status updates appear in Matrix room with proper formatting
- Guidance requests are relayed to calling agent and responses returned to dev agent
- Error handling and retries are implemented for message delivery failures

## Notes

- Coordinate with WorkspaceManager to update memory blocks
- Ensure human participants receive relevant updates without control permissions
- Use Matrix event IDs for tracking and deduplication

Huly Issue: LETTA-224

title: Matrix conversation archiving and review tooling

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement Matrix (Synapse) as a coordination layer between Letta calling agents and OpenCode execution agents, enabling bidirectional communication, human-in-the-loop participation, and conversation archiving.

## Scope

- Create Matrix rooms per OpenCode task with automatic participant management
- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

comments.text:
## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

Matrix-based multi-agent coordination via Synapse

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement Matrix (Synapse) as a coordination layer between Letta calling agents and OpenCode execution agents, enabling bidirectional communication, human-in-the-loop participation, and conversation archiving.

## Scope

- Create Matrix rooms per OpenCode task with automatic participant management
- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

Huly Issue: LETTA-448

title: Matrix conversation archiving and review tooling

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement Matrix (Synapse) as a coordination layer between Letta calling agents and OpenCode execution agents, enabling bidirectional communication, human-in-the-loop participation, and conversation archiving.

## Scope

- Create Matrix rooms per OpenCode task with automatic participant management
- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

title: Task cancellation, pause, and resume support

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Add task control capabilities (cancel, pause, resume) to the Letta OpenCode Plugin and ensure they are triggered via Matrix commands.

## Scope

- Extend ExecutionManager to support pause/resume signals
- Implement safe cancellation that stops Docker container execution
- Connect Matrix control messages to task control actions
- Update workspace blocks with control status changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending  command in Matrix immediately stops task execution and updates status
- Pause/resume commands suspend and resume container execution with logging
- Workspace block events reflect control actions with timestamps
- Automated tests cover control flows and error cases (e.g., pause before start)

## Notes

- Coordinate with TaskRegistry for status tracking
- Consider Docker pause/unpause for container control
- Ensure idempotent control actions (no double cancellation)

Huly Issue: LETTA-178

title: OpenCode Server Migration (replace CLI with HTTP API)

comments.author: root
comments.text:
Objective: Migrate Letta OpenCode Plugin from invoking Claude CLI directly to integrating with the OpenCode headless HTTP server (opencode serve) using the official @opencode-ai/sdk.

Why:

- Structured API for sessions, messages, files
- Real-time event streaming via /event
- Better control (abort, observe, permissions)
- File/status access and richer results

Scope:

- Build/run OpenCode server in Docker per task
- Connect via @opencode-ai/sdk client
- Create/manage sessions, send prompts, stream events
- Map events to Workspace blocks and Matrix
- Expose file tools to agents (list/read)
- Maintain current tool surface and memory lifecycle
- Backward-compat flag and rollout plan

Done when:

- All existing tools continue to work
- New file access tools available
- Event stream updates arrive in Workspace
- Control signals (cancel) mapped to abort
- Tests pass and deployment stable

## Objective

Conduct comprehensive research on the Letta TypeScript SDK to understand its full capabilities, API patterns, and integration requirements for building an OpenCode plugin.

## Research Areas

### 1. SDK Client Initialization

- Client setup for local server (http://localhost:8283)
- Client setup for Letta Cloud (token + project authentication)
- Configuration options and environment variables
- Connection management and error handling

### 2. Agent Management

- Agent creation and configuration
- Agent lifecycle operations (list, get, update, delete)
- Agent state management
- Tool attachment to agents

### 3. Memory Operations

- Core memory structure and management
- Memory blocks (create, read, update, delete)
- Archival memory operations
- Memory persistence patterns

### 4. Tool Management

- Tool registration and discovery
- MCP server tool integration
- Tool execution and coordination
- Custom tool creation

### 5. Message Operations

- Sending messages to agents
- Message history retrieval
- Streaming responses
- Message formatting and context

### 6. API Patterns

- REST API endpoint structure
- Request/response formats
- Error handling conventions
- Rate limiting and pagination

## Documentation Sources

- npm package: @letta-ai/letta-client
- Letta API documentation (REST API reference)
- Python SDK for comparison (letta-client)
- Existing MCP integrations (letta-tools server)

## Deliverables

1. Comprehensive SDK capability matrix
2. API endpoint documentation
3. Authentication and configuration patterns
4. Integration architecture design
5. Tool interface specifications
6. Example code snippets and patterns

## Success Criteria

- Complete understanding of SDK capabilities
- Clear integration strategy defined
- Technical architecture documented
- Ready to begin implementation phase

Huly Issue: LETTA-94

title: Task cancellation, pause, and resume support

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Add task control capabilities (cancel, pause, resume) to the Letta OpenCode Plugin and ensure they are triggered via Matrix commands.

## Scope

- Extend ExecutionManager to support pause/resume signals
- Implement safe cancellation that stops Docker container execution
- Connect Matrix control messages to task control actions
- Update workspace blocks with control status changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending  command in Matrix immediately stops task execution and updates status
- Pause/resume commands suspend and resume container execution with logging
- Workspace block events reflect control actions with timestamps
- Automated tests cover control flows and error cases (e.g., pause before start)

## Notes

- Coordinate with TaskRegistry for status tracking
- Consider Docker pause/unpause for container control
- Ensure idempotent control actions (no double cancellation)

## Conventional Commits

- feat: minor version bump
- fix: patch version bump
- BREAKING CHANGE: major version bump

## Tools to consider

- semantic-release or release-please
- conventional-changelog

- Coordinate with docker-build.yml (already builds on tags)
- Add release notes template

Huly Issue: LETTA-98

title: Evaluate and reuse opencode-mcp-tool repo for MCP server scaffolding

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

- What the block contains

Huly Issue: LETTA-403

title: Bidirectional communication layer (cancel/pause/resume/updates)

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement a communication layer supporting bidirectional signals between Letta agents and OpenCode tasks via Matrix, covering cancellation, pause/resume, runtime updates, and feedback loops.

## Scope

- Define CommunicationLayer interface
- Implement task control signals: cancel, pause, resume
- Add runtime update mechanism for injecting new context mid-execution
- Support feedback loop where agent reviews artifacts and requests changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending Matrix control message updates task status (cancel/pause/resume)
- Runtime updates modify workspace block metadata and notify execution
- Feedback messages tracked and acknowledged by dev agent
- Unit tests simulate control signals and ensure proper propagation

## Notes

- Use Matrix message types described in design doc
- Ensure resilience (e.g., retry on delivery failures)
- Integrate with ExecutionManager to handle pause/resume commands

title: Runtime updates and feedback loop implementation

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

## Objective

Conduct comprehensive research on the Letta TypeScript SDK to understand its full capabilities, API patterns, and integration requirements for building an OpenCode plugin.

- Connection management and error handling

### 2. Agent Management

- Agent creation and configuration
- Agent lifecycle operations (list, get, update, delete)
- Agent state management
- Tool attachment to agents

### 3. Memory Operations

- Core memory structure and management

- Archival memory operations
- Memory persistence patterns

### 4. Tool Management

- Tool registration and discovery
- MCP server tool integration
- Tool execution and coordination
- Custom tool creation

### 5. Message Operations

- Sending messages to agents
- Message history retrieval
- Streaming responses
- Message formatting and context

### 6. API Patterns

- REST API endpoint structure
- Request/response formats
- Error handling conventions
- Rate limiting and pagination

## Documentation Sources

- npm package: @letta-ai/letta-client
- Letta API documentation (REST API reference)
- Python SDK for comparison (letta-client)
- Existing MCP integrations (letta-tools server)

## Deliverables

1. Comprehensive SDK capability matrix
2. API endpoint documentation
3. Authentication and configuration patterns
4. Integration architecture design
5. Tool interface specifications
6. Example code snippets and patterns

## Success Criteria

- Complete understanding of SDK capabilities
- Clear integration strategy defined
- Technical architecture documented
- Ready to begin implementation phase

Huly Issue: LETTA-139

title: Evaluate and reuse opencode-mcp-tool repo for MCP server scaffolding

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

Huly Issue: LETTA-7

title: Matrix-based multi-agent coordination via Synapse

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Implement Matrix (Synapse) as a coordination layer between Letta calling agents and OpenCode execution agents, enabling bidirectional communication, human-in-the-loop participation, and conversation archiving.

## Scope

- Create Matrix rooms per OpenCode task with automatic participant management
- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Conduct comprehensive research on the Letta TypeScript SDK to understand its full capabilities, API patterns, and integration requirements for building an OpenCode plugin.

## Research Areas

### 1. SDK Client Initialization

- Client setup for local server (http://localhost:8283)
- Client setup for Letta Cloud (token + project authentication)
- Configuration options and environment variables
- Connection management and error handling

### 2. Agent Management

- Agent creation and configuration
- Agent lifecycle operations (list, get, update, delete)
- Agent state management
- Tool attachment to agents

### 3. Memory Operations

- Core memory structure and management
- Memory blocks (create, read, update, delete)
- Archival memory operations
- Memory persistence patterns

### 4. Tool Management

- Tool registration and discovery
- MCP server tool integration
- Tool execution and coordination
- Custom tool creation

### 5. Message Operations

- Sending messages to agents
- Message history retrieval
- Streaming responses
- Message formatting and context

### 6. API Patterns

- REST API endpoint structure
- Request/response formats
- Error handling conventions
- Rate limiting and pagination

## Documentation Sources

- npm package: @letta-ai/letta-client
- Letta API documentation (REST API reference)
- Python SDK for comparison (letta-client)
- Existing MCP integrations (letta-tools server)

## Deliverables

1. Comprehensive SDK capability matrix
2. API endpoint documentation
3. Authentication and configuration patterns
4. Integration architecture design
5. Tool interface specifications
6. Example code snippets and patterns

## Success Criteria

- Complete understanding of SDK capabilities
- Clear integration strategy defined
- Technical architecture documented
- Ready to begin implementation phase

## Objective

Provide tooling to archive Matrix task rooms and enable later review of conversations, including search, replay, and summary capabilities.

## Scope

- Implement room archival process post-task completion
- Store conversation metadata linked to workspace blocks and task IDs
- Provide scripts/API to retrieve archives and generate summaries
- Integrate with future analytics/learning modules

## Acceptance Criteria

-  closes room and stores conversation history (events, participants, timestamps)
- Archive metadata searchable by task ID, agent ID, date range
- Summary report generated including key events (control signals, updates, completion)
- Documentation on how to retrieve and review archived conversations

## Notes

- Consider Matrix export APIs or client-side event fetching
- Store archives in dedicated storage (e.g., S3, database, filesystem)
- Ensure access control for archived data
- Coordinate with LETTA analytics roadmap

- Documentation on how to retrieve and review archived conversations

## Notes

- Consider Matrix export APIs or client-side event fetching
- Store archives in dedicated storage (e.g., S3, database, filesystem)
- Ensure access control for archived data
- Coordinate with LETTA analytics roadmap

Huly Issue: LETTA-83

title: Types and config updates for OpenCode integration

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

## Notes

- Store archives in dedicated storage (e.g., S3, database, filesystem)
- Ensure access control for archived data
- Coordinate with LETTA analytics roadmap

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Add task control capabilities (cancel, pause, resume) to the Letta OpenCode Plugin and ensure they are triggered via Matrix commands.

## Scope

- Extend ExecutionManager to support pause/resume signals
- Implement safe cancellation that stops Docker container execution
- Connect Matrix control messages to task control actions
- Update workspace blocks with control status changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending  command in Matrix immediately stops task execution and updates status
- Pause/resume commands suspend and resume container execution with logging
- Workspace block events reflect control actions with timestamps
- Automated tests cover control flows and error cases (e.g., pause before start)

## Notes

- Coordinate with TaskRegistry for status tracking
- Consider Docker pause/unpause for container control
- Ensure idempotent control actions (no double cancellation)

## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

Huly Issue: LETTA-608

title: End-to-end Matrix coordination integration tests

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Develop integration tests that validate the full Matrix-based coordination flow: task creation, room setup, bidirectional messaging, task control, and archival.

## Scope

- Create automated tests simulating Letta calling agent, OpenCode dev agent, and optional human participant
- Use Matrix test rooms with mocked Synapse server or local deployment
- Verify message routing, task control signals, runtime updates, and archiving

## Acceptance Criteria

- Test suite spins up Matrix test environment and Letta OpenCode Plugin instance
- Scenario coverage:
  1. Task creation → Matrix room → agent ↔ dev messaging → completion
  2. Task cancellation via Matrix command
  3. Runtime update → dev acknowledgement → updated artifact
  4. Human observer joins and sends feedback
  5. Archive generation and retrieval
- Tests integrated into CI pipeline with documentation

## Notes

- Consider using matrix-bot-sdk testing utilities
- Provide environment setup scripts for local testing
- Coordinate with LETTA-23 for archival verification

- Calling  creates Matrix room titled  with topic set to task description
-  handles both agent IDs and human Matrix user IDs
-  archives room and posts closing summary
- Room metadata includes task ID, agent IDs, timestamps

## Notes

- Use  patterns for power levels
- Ensure human observers default to read-only permissions
- Store room metadata in workspace block for retrieval

title: Design OpenCode-as-Appendage architecture for Letta agent delegation

comments.author: root
comments.text: Synced from Huly: LETTA-429

title: Evaluate and reuse opencode-mcp-tool repo for MCP server scaffolding

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

- Sending  command in Matrix immediately stops task execution and updates status
- Pause/resume commands suspend and resume container execution with logging
- Workspace block events reflect control actions with timestamps
- Automated tests cover control flows and error cases (e.g., pause before start)

## Notes

- Coordinate with TaskRegistry for status tracking
- Consider Docker pause/unpause for container control
- Ensure idempotent control actions (no double cancellation)

## Objective

Implement a communication layer supporting bidirectional signals between Letta agents and OpenCode tasks via Matrix, covering cancellation, pause/resume, runtime updates, and feedback loops.

- Define CommunicationLayer interface
- Implement task control signals: cancel, pause, resume
- Add runtime update mechanism for injecting new context mid-execution
- Support feedback loop where agent reviews artifacts and requests changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending Matrix control message updates task status (cancel/pause/resume)
- Runtime updates modify workspace block metadata and notify execution
- Feedback messages tracked and acknowledged by dev agent
- Unit tests simulate control signals and ensure proper propagation

## Notes

- Use Matrix message types described in design doc
- Ensure resilience (e.g., retry on delivery failures)
- Integrate with ExecutionManager to handle pause/resume commands

Huly Issue: LETTA-217

title: Types and config updates for OpenCode integration

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Reuse: tool registry pattern, progress notification keepalive loop, CLI execution wrapper abstraction
- Replace: transport with Streamable HTTP, SDK ^1.16.0, tool set with our  +  tools
- Add: Letta API client, Execution Manager (container spawn/limits), idempotency/queue, optimistic concurrency on workspace blocks

## Deliverables

1. Delta design doc (what to keep, what to change)
2. Migration tasks list (SDK upgrade, transport switch, new tools, remove legacy tools)
3. Spike PR to port skeleton and boot a streamable HTTP MCP server

## Acceptance Criteria

- Documented decision (reuse vs fresh)
- If reuse: working HTTP MCP server boots with health log
- Clear task breakdown for upgrade path

Huly Issue: LETTA-103

title: Runtime updates and feedback loop implementation

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Enable Letta calling agents (and human participants) to provide runtime updates and feedback to OpenCode tasks, supporting iterative correction and refinement.

## Scope

- Extend WorkspaceManager to track runtime updates and feedback events
- Implement Matrix message handling for runtime updates (requirement changes) and feedback requests
- Notify OpenCode dev agent of new updates and track acknowledgements
- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

Huly Issue: LETTA-150

title: Task cancellation, pause, and resume support

comments.author: root
comments.text:
## Objective

Add task control capabilities (cancel, pause, resume) to the Letta OpenCode Plugin and ensure they are triggered via Matrix commands.

## Scope

- Extend ExecutionManager to support pause/resume signals
- Implement safe cancellation that stops Docker container execution
- Connect Matrix control messages to task control actions
- Update workspace blocks with control status changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- Sending  command in Matrix immediately stops task execution and updates status
- Pause/resume commands suspend and resume container execution with logging
- Workspace block events reflect control actions with timestamps
- Automated tests cover control flows and error cases (e.g., pause before start)

## Notes

- Coordinate with TaskRegistry for status tracking
- Consider Docker pause/unpause for container control
- Ensure idempotent control actions (no double cancellation)

## Objective

Review the archived repo https://github.com/frap129/opencode-mcp-tool and decide what to reuse for our MCP-only OpenCode appendage server.

## Findings (initial)

- Uses @modelcontextprotocol/sdk v0.5.0 (outdated) and StdioServerTransport only
- Provides MCP server skeleton with tools registry, prompts, progress notifications/keepalive
- Tools implemented: ask-opencode, brainstorm, timeout-test, ping, help, slash commands
- Executes OpenCode via local CLI (no containerization, no Letta integration)
- No auth, idempotency, queuing, or workspace block concepts
- MIT licensed (compatible for reuse)

## Reuse Plan

- Route messages between Letta agents, OpenCode dev agents, and human observers
- Support task control signals (cancel, pause/resume) and runtime updates
- Archive conversations for later review and learning

## Success Criteria

- New Matrix integration architecture documented
- End-to-end task flow demonstrated: task creation → Matrix room → bidirectional messaging → archival
- Human observer can join task room and provide feedback

## Deliverables

1. Architecture & configuration docs
2. Matrix coordination services (room manager, message router, communication layer)
3. Integration tests covering agent ↔ dev ↔ human loop

## Dependencies

- LETTA-9 through LETTA-14 (MCP server core) – completed
- LETTA-10 (Letta client adapter) – completed

## Out of Scope

- External federation across organizations
- Advanced analytics/learning from conversations

- Provide API for dev agent to request clarification or confirm updates

## Acceptance Criteria

- Runtime updates appear in workspace block metadata and Matrix room with context
- Dev agent receives updates and confirms receipt (logged in Matrix)
- Feedback loop supports: request review → provide corrections → confirmation
- Tests cover scenarios: new requirements mid-task, versioning of updates, human feedback

## Notes

- Ensure updates do not overwrite existing metadata (merge strategy)
- Provide clear logging for update history for auditing
- Coordinate with message router for consistent event tagging

title: OpenCode Server Migration (replace CLI with HTTP API)

comments.author: root
comments.text:
Objective: Migrate Letta OpenCode Plugin from invoking Claude CLI directly to integrating with the OpenCode headless HTTP server (opencode serve) using the official @opencode-ai/sdk.

Why:

- Structured API for sessions, messages, files
- Real-time event streaming via /event
- Better control (abort, observe, permissions)
- File/status access and richer results

Scope:

- Build/run OpenCode server in Docker per task
- Connect via @opencode-ai/sdk client
- Create/manage sessions, send prompts, stream events
- Map events to Workspace blocks and Matrix
- Expose file tools to agents (list/read)
- Maintain current tool surface and memory lifecycle
- Backward-compat flag and rollout plan

Done when:

- All existing tools continue to work
- New file access tools available
- Event stream updates arrive in Workspace
- Control signals (cancel) mapped to abort
- Tests pass and deployment stable

    schedule:

    groups:
